 139 -    def sort_update_files(update_list): 

 140          """ 
 141          docstring_title 
 142   
 143          @param update_list:  
 144          @type update_list:  
 145          @return:  
 146          @rtype:  
 147          """ 
 148          sort_dict = {} 
 149          # sort per year 
 150          for item in update_list: 
 151              # get year 
 152              year = item.split("-")[1] 
 153              if year in sort_dict: 
 154                  sort_dict[year].append(item) 
 155              else: 
 156                  sort_dict[year] = [] 
 157                  sort_dict[year].append(item) 
 158          new_list = [] 
 159          keys = sorted(sort_dict.keys()) 
 160          for key in keys: 
 161              sort_dict[key].sort() 
 162              new_list += sort_dict[key] 
 163          del sort_dict 
 164          return new_list

 265 -        def __init__(self, src):

 269 -        def _zap_parens(self, src, dest, disjunction=False): 

 270              if not src: 
 271                  return dest 
 272              i = iter(src) 
 273              for x in i: 
 274                  if isinstance(x, const_get_stringtype()): 
 275                      if x == '||': 
 276                          x = self._zap_parens(next(i), [], disjunction=True) 
 277                          if len(x) == 1: 
 278                              dest.append(x[0]) 
 279                          else: 
 280                              dest.append("||") 
 281                              dest.append(x) 
 282                      elif x.endswith("?"): 
 283                          dest.append(x) 
 284                          dest.append(self._zap_parens(next(i), [])) 
 285                      else: 
 286                          dest.append(x) 
 287                  else: 
 288                      if disjunction: 
 289                          x = self._zap_parens(x, []) 
 290                          if len(x) == 1: 
 291                              dest.append(x[0]) 
 292                          else: 
 293                              dest.append(x) 
 294                      else: 
 295                          self._zap_parens(x, dest) 
 296              return dest

3631 -    def _paren_reduce(self, mystr): 

3632          """ 
3633   
3634              # deps.py -- Portage dependency resolution functions 
3635              # Copyright 2003-2004 Gentoo Foundation 
3636              # Distributed under the terms of the GNU General Public License v2 
3637              # $Id: portage_dep.py 9174 2008-01-11 05:49:02Z zmedico $ 
3638   
3639          Take a string and convert all paren enclosed entities into sublists, optionally 
3640          futher splitting the list elements by spaces. 
3641   
3642          Example usage: 
3643                  >>> paren_reduce('foobar foo ( bar baz )',1) 
3644                  ['foobar', 'foo', ['bar', 'baz']] 
3645                  >>> paren_reduce('foobar foo ( bar baz )',0) 
3646                  ['foobar foo ', [' bar baz ']] 
3647   
3648          @param mystr: The string to reduce 
3649          @type mystr: String 
3650          @rtype: Array 
3651          @return: The reduced string in an array 
3652          """ 
3653          mylist = [] 
3654          while mystr: 
3655              left_paren = mystr.find("(") 
3656              has_left_paren = left_paren != -1 
3657              right_paren = mystr.find(")") 
3658              has_right_paren = right_paren != -1 
3659              if not has_left_paren and not has_right_paren: 
3660                  freesec = mystr 
3661                  subsec = None 
3662                  tail = "" 
3663              elif mystr[0] == ")": 
3664                  return [mylist, mystr[1:]] 
3665              elif has_left_paren and not has_right_paren: 
3666                  raise InvalidDependString( 
3667                          "InvalidDependString: %s: '%s'" % (_("missing right parenthesis"), mystr,)) 
3668              elif has_left_paren and left_paren < right_paren: 
3669                  freesec, subsec = mystr.split("(", 1) 
3670                  subsec, tail = self._paren_reduce(subsec) 
3671              else: 
3672                  subsec, tail = mystr.split(")", 1) 
3673                  subsec = self._strip_empty(subsec.split(" ")) 
3674                  return [mylist+subsec, tail] 
3675              mystr = tail 
3676              if freesec: 
3677                  mylist = mylist + self._strip_empty(freesec.split(" ")) 
3678              if subsec is not None: 
3679                  mylist = mylist + [subsec] 
3680          return mylist

3712          leaving an array with subarrays

3714          @param deparray: paren_reduce'd list of deps

3746          # behavior will be explicitly enabled as necessary. 
3747          _dep_check_strict = False

3753

3756                  if additions: 
3757                      rlist.append(additions) 
3758                  elif rlist and rlist[-1] == "||": 
3759                      #XXX: Currently some DEPEND strings have || lists without default atoms. 
3760                      #   raise portage_exception.InvalidDependString("No default atom(s) in \""+paren_enclose(deparray)+"\"") 
3761                      rlist.append([]) 
3762              else: 
3763                  if head[-1] == "?": # Use reduce next group on fail. 
3764                      # Pull any other use conditions and the following atom or list into a separate array 
3765                      newdeparray = [head] 
3766                      while isinstance(newdeparray[-1], const_get_stringtype()) and newdeparray[-1][-1] == "?": 
3767                          if mydeparray: 
3768                              newdeparray.append(mydeparray.pop(0)) 
3769                          else: 
3770                              raise ValueError(_("Conditional with no target"))

3776                          self.output( 
3777                              darkred("PortagePlugin._use_reduce(): %s" % (mytxt,)), 
3778                              importance = 0, 
3779                              level = "error", 
3780                              header = bold(" !!! ") 
3781                          )

3785                          self.output( 
3786                              darkred("PortagePlugin._use_reduce(): %s" % (mytxt,)), 
3787                              importance = 0, 
3788                              level = "error", 
3789                              header = bold(" !!! ") 
3790                          ) 
3791                          warned = 1

3795                              importance = 0, 
3796                              level = "error", 
3797                              header = bold(" !!! ") 
3798                          ) 
3799   
3800                      # Check that each flag matches 
3801                      ismatch = True 
3802                      missing_flag = False 
3803                      for head in newdeparray[:-1]: 
3804                          head = head[:-1] 
3805                          if not head: 
3806                              missing_flag = True 
3807                              break 
3808                          if head.startswith("!"): 
3809                              head_key = head[1:] 
3810                              if not head_key: 
3811                                  missing_flag = True 
3812                                  break 
3813                              if not matchall and head_key in uselist or \ 
3814                                  head_key in excludeall: 
3815                                  ismatch = False 
3816                                  break 
3817                          elif head not in masklist:

3819                                      ismatch = False
